lead_paragraph: Mr. de Blasio said on Monday that his administration was creating housing affordable to poor and working-class New Yorkers faster than any of his predecessors. That drive may soon hit a speed bump.

headline.print_headline: Looming End of Tax-Break Program Could Harm Mayor’s Housing Plan
headline.main: Looming End of Tax-Break Program Could Harm Mayor’s Housing Plan

snippet: Mr. de Blasio said on Monday that his administration was creating housing affordable to poor and working-class New Yorkers faster than any of his predecessors. That drive may soon hit a speed bump.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio boasts that his administration is building and preserving affordable housing faster than any previous administration; drive to build 200,000 affordable housing units over course of 10 years may run into serious obstacles, however, as obscure tax-break program used to create them will expire unless developers and construction unions reach agreement on wages for future projects under subsidy program.
